Description: Three glazed composition (faience) wedjat-eye amulets; mould-made and covered with a blue-green glaze, the eye-ball rendered in black; perforated along the long axis for suspension. Nos. 70 and 71 are very schematic; 72 is more detailed with incised lines around the eye and the edges of the amulet; glaze worn on all three examples.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Amathus
Curator's comments: For other examples of wedjat pendants from Amathus, Clerc 1991, 133-9. Also, Clerc et al. 1976, 118-19 for examples from the sanctuary at Kition-Kathari. Lagarce (in Clerc et al. 1976, 167-74) provides a useful overview of the use and significance of Egyptianizing amulets and scarabs on Cyprus which often differ from those found in Egyptian contexts. Bibliography: Clerc G. 1991, 'Aegyptiaca', in eds V. Karageorghis et al., La nécrople d'Amathonte Tombes 110-385. V (Nicosia), 1-50. Clerc G. et al. 1976, Fouilles de Kition. II. Objets égyptiens et égyptisants (Nicosia).
Bibliographic references: Murray, Smith and Walters 1900 / Excavations in Cyprus (p.117, Tomb 31)
